extendedIngredients.name: baguette
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/2 baguette or Italian bread, cubed (about 3 cups)

extendedIngredients.name: broccoli
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 bunch fresh broccoli, cut into small florets, stalks removed

extendedIngredients.name: chicken breasts
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 pound boneless chicken breasts (or a rotisserie chicken, meat removed and cut into bite-size pieces)

extendedIngredients.name: coarse salt
extendedIngredients.originalString: coarse salt and fresh black pepper

extendedIngredients.name: lemon zest
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 teaspoon grated lemon zest, just the yellow part not the white pith

extendedIngredients.name: parmesan
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/4 cup grated Parmesan, plus more for serving

recipes.title: Broccoli, Chicken and Feta Pasta with Parmesan Croutons

winePairing.pairingText: Chardonnay, Pinot Noir, and Sauvignon Blanc are my top picks for Chicken. White meat is typically paired with white wine as to not overpower the flavor of the meat, so chardonnay and sauvignon blanc are safe choices. Chicken prepared with a tomato sauce or certainly a red wine sauce can and should be served with a red like a pinot noir. The Mercer Estates Zephyr Ridge Vineyard Reserve Chardonnay with a 5 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 35 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Mercer Estates Zephyr Ridge Vineyard Reserve Chardonnay
productMatches.description: Aromas of apricot, guava and pineapple juice mingle with hints of sweet vanilla and warm toasty notes.

recipes.instructions: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Pour a tablespoon of oil onto the middle of a large baking sheet or roasting pan, add bread and toss around to coat the croutons, sprinkle with parmesan and season lightly with salt and pepper. Bake until lightly golden 8 to 10 minutes.Meanwhile use 1 tablespoon oil to coat the grill rack, then heat to medium-high. Season chicken with salt and pepper. Grill on each side until cooked through (165-174 degrees F). Remove and set aside for 5-10 minutes then thinly slice into bite-size pieces.In a large pot of boiling salted water, cook pasta and broccoli together to al dente, reserving 1/2 cup of the water before draining. Add the remaining 3 tablespoons oil along with the garlic to the pan over low heat. When garlic is fragrant add pasta, broccoli, chicken, feta and lemon zest. Toss well, drizzling with the reserved pasta water if needed to create a sauce.  Serve sprinkled with croutons and parmesan.

steps.step: Pour a tablespoon of oil onto the middle of a large baking sheet or roasting pan, add bread and toss around to coat the croutons, sprinkle with parmesan and season lightly with salt and pepper.

Bake until lightly golden 8 to 10 minutes.Meanwhile use 1 tablespoon oil to coat the grill rack, then heat to medium-high. Season chicken with salt and pepper. Grill on each side until cooked through (165-174 degrees F).

Remove and set aside for 5-10 minutes then thinly slice into bite-size pieces.In a large pot of boiling salted water, cook pasta and broccoli together to al dente, reserving 1/2 cup of the water before draining.

Add the remaining 3 tablespoons oil along with the garlic to the pan over low heat. When garlic is fragrant add pasta, broccoli, chicken, feta and lemon zest. Toss well, drizzling with the reserved pasta water if needed to create a sauce.
Serve sprinkled with croutons and parmesan.
